office: House Committee on Education and Labor (Democratic staff)
key_responsibilities: leading a discrete number of higher education issue areas
researching, reviewing, and drafting legislation
providing technical assistance to Member offices
preparing written materials including talking points, letters, memos, and legislative analyses
tracking regulatory developments, floor activity, and the related activities of other committees
supporting the execution of committee preceedings and events related to higher education
coordinating with the oversight and communications teams in support of the Committee’s agenda
requirements: Proficiency of programs authorized in the Higher Education Act
two to four years of higher education policy or research experience or two years of higher education policy or research experience and an advanced degree
exceptional writing, communication, and organizational skills
ability to successfully manage multiple projects under deadlines
collaborative disposition
commitment to social justice and expanding economic opportunity

key_responsibilities: drafting and advancing legislation
preparing talking points, vote recommendations, and other legislative materials
monitoring and analyzing legislative developments, committee proceedings
representing the Member in meetings with constituents and stakeholders
requirements: proactive
exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail
interested in working in a fast-paced office environment
at least one year of agriculture policy experience

office: House Committee on Oversight and Reform
key_responsibilities: answering telephones
receiving visitors at the front desk
assisting with the tracking and processing of committee correspondence
receiving, tracking and processing large document productions
providing administrative support for committee hearings, markups and meetings
entering data and navigating databases with accuracy
proofreading documents and correspondence for style and typographical errors
requirements: excellent organizational and time management skills
ability to work cooperatively and courteously with others
strong written and oral communication skills
proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel
good judgment and discretion
flexibility in assisting with daily tasks and projects
One year of prior Capitol Hill experience is strongly preferred

key_responsibilities: making vote recommendations
staffing meetings
writing policy memos
drafting legislation under the guidance of the Legislative Director
requirements: 2-3 years minimum Capitol Hill experience
strong writing skills
attention to detail
foundational understanding of House procedure
dedication to the Constitution
Iowa ties a plus

key_responsibilities: persuasive writing
monitoring and explaining economic data
conceiving and executing Congressional hearings on big-picture fiscal and economic issues
working collaboratively with other analytical staff as needs arise
requirements: strong skills in written and oral communication, policy analysis, and quantitative analysis
ability to work effectively under tight deadline
several years of relevant experience in Congress, a federal agency (such as OMB, CBO, CEA, or Treasury), or a think tank
familiarity with the legislative process
an advanced degree in economics or a related field

preparing for hearings

answering casework correspondence
communicating and meeting with constituents
executing district outreach on behalf of the Member
requirements: self-motivated
ability to work cooperatively and courteously with others
a drive to get things done
bachelor’s degree or higher education level is preferred

key_responsibilities: reviewing financial statements and providing legal advice on a high volume of financial disclosure issues
education and training to Members of Congress and their staff through frequent telephone calls, in-person meetings, and written work product
requirements: outstanding analytical and written and oral communication skills
sound judgment necessary to evaluate the sensitive matters that arise before the Committee
Experience in one or more of the following areas is desirable: government ethics, ethics counseling, accounting, auditing, investment management, taxation, corporate finance, and securities law

key_responsibilities: conducting investigations and adjudicatory and disciplinary proceedings regarding Members and staff of the U.S. House of Representatives
requirements: outstanding analytical and written/oral communications skills
sound judgment necessary to evaluate the sensitive matters that arise before the Committee

Experience in one or more of the following areas is desirable: government ethics; campaign finance; criminal law; employment law, including the laws governing sexual harassment in the workplace; civil litigation; administrative investigations and adjudications; depositions; and financial accounting

key_responsibilities: drafting memos and preparing background materials for Members and staff

drafting letters

strong understanding of the Committee process and procedures of the House of Representatives
ability to perform under short timelines and in a high-pressure environment while juggling competing priorities
excellent writing and analytical skills

positive attitude

office: House Office of Diversity and Inclusion
key_responsibilities: leading data and research collection and analysis for the Office of Diversity and Inclusion
leading the development of the required diversity report
maintaining key metrics and key performance indicators for the Office
serving as a resource for external and internal diversity best practices

serving as the project manager for any consultants and/or contractors with whom the Office may engage to support the completion of the diversity report and to develop relevant diversity and inclusion-based training, in collaboration with the Congressional Staff Academy
assisting in the translation of research findings into materials that staff can effectively utilize in their engagements with Members and Member offices
providing research support on diversity and inclusion studies, techniques and tools
serving as project manager for the diversity report and, where necessary, direct and coordinate activities of external consultants
researching and studying best practices for retention and growth in House employing offices
leading data tracking and reporting with a focus on performance and results
preparing regular updates and briefing documents on research that is relevant to House employing offices
assisting with the development and delivery of training sessions and, as needed, conducting presentations at professional conferences and meetings
requirements: Master’s degree in social or behavioral sciences or related field; or equivalent level of experience providing technical assistance, data collections and/or research
knowledge and experience in diversity, equity, and inclusion research efforts, ideally with a strong background in curriculum development
current working knowledge of coalition functioning, evaluation and research
quantitative and qualitative evaluation and research skills
expertise using relevant software
customer-service orientation and ability to work harmoniously with a diverse team
ability to work under deadline pressure and extra hours if needed on assignment
demonstrated ability to self-motivate, initiate project activities, and work on multiple assignments simultaneously
extensive computer skills, including data input
